subject: Add power restore policy page
commitMessage:
Add power restore policy page

- This page will show how the system boots once power
  is restored after a power disturbance.

- API used to fetch the JSON:
  /redfish/v1/JsonSchemas/ComputerSystem/ComputerSystem.json
- API used to fetch the current policy and to save updated policy:
  /redfish/v1/Systems/system/

Signed-off-by: Sukanya Pandey <sukapan1@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I203bd3c5d26071b882cce6b9950cdb3fb1deb212

Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Please update both the AppHeader and AppNavigation spec files. When navigation is changed, both spec files require an update. Until we have merged the update to run tests as part of the pre-commit hook, we will need to run unit tests manually.

- npm run test:update -- -u tests/unit/AppHeader.spec.js
- npm run test:update -- -u tests/unit/AppNavigation.spec.js

Patch Set 15:

I found an odd bug. If I select Last state and save there is a 500 error. I expect that with the backend in place on the BMC I am testing. However, when I try to change to Always off, I receive a 500 error again. If I review the request, it is sending LastState instead of AlwaysOff.

If I change the value to Always on, it sends the correct value, AlwaysOn, to the backend and I receive a 204. If I change to Always off and submit the request, it succeeds and sends the correct value of AlwaysOff in the request. Can you please look into that?

not all companies have this as a default, can we drop this?
Done
Shouldn't be 'Camel Case'?
Done
This description should be revisited by design. It doesn't match our writing style

Discussed in slack and with our content creator Stephanie, determined the description should be updated to:

Configure power policy to determine how the system starts after a power disturbance.
Done
should this button show if the v-if above is false and there is no content displayed above the button?
thoughts..?
Sorry, I missed this, done and pushed the changes, Thanks!

Sorry, I didn't look at this closely enough. I saw the dollar sign and thought the plugin and translation function was passed to the vue file. I think this is fine the way it was and also the change. Thanks for updating
We can remove this v-if, there is no need to hide the radio options if we can't get the values from the backend since users won't be able to save the setting anyway if that happens
I have added this v-if to hide label if currentPowerPolicy is not coming from BE. I have changed the code now and added to <b-form-group>

I still think the label and option should always show even if they are not available from the backend (no v-if). If they aren't available then under the label it should say "Not available" like on the overview page for power consumption. I talked to Derick and he said that machines with the right firmware image will always have the power restore options available, so we won't need to hide the options (and possibly do not need to provide "Not available" text in place of missing radio options).
I was hiding the label until selected policy received from API, now I have removed the v-if condition, so now the label will be there in any condition.
did we validate with rahul for this test hook?
Thanks! i have removed it, it was added by mistake.

not sure there is much value in using mapGetters since you are only pulling one value.

ok with this, just a thought
Yeah, i have changed it, thanks!

why won't this PowerRestorePolicy be in a separate store?
PowerCap and PowerRestorePolicy don't have a ton in common. 

PowerCap is per chassis and enforces not using more than x watts.
PowerRestorePolicy is for the system and tell the system where to boot to after a powerloss.

The store name is PowerControl so I have kept all the power related operations in one store.
If its required I will create separate store for power restore policy component.
Ack
Done the changes and pushed the code.
